intro: Epilobium glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in wet or disturbed soils, such as marshes and riverbanks. The plant has slender, hairless stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often reddish in color. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, with four petals, and bloom in late summer. Epilobium glaberrimum is often found in moist habitats and can be an indicator species for wetland environments.
